rows.question_text: For me this practice is...

Which of the four main developmental stages does your child belong to?
What will you do to ensure that this child will grow well physically (growth)?
What will you do to ensure that this child will grow well cognitively (thinking)?
What will you do to ensure that this child will grow well emotionally (feelings)?
What will you do to ensure that this child will grow well socially (social awareness)?
How does the child feel when the parent does pay attention?
How does the parent feel about the child?
What do you think of the parent's actions?
How does the child feel when the  parent controls the game? "
How does the mother show attention to Doreen?
rows.option_1_text: Invites both of them to play together
rows.option_3_text: Allows the child to teach them about the game in her way

rows.question_text: How does the mother help Doreen to do what she wants without controlling her?
rows.option_1_text: Joins and enjoys the play moment
rows.option_2_text: Praise the child during the play
rows.option_3_text: Informs her that they will join the play someother time

rows.question_text: How does this make Doreen feel?
rows.option_1_text: Doreen feels loved and cared for
rows.option_2_text: She feels good about their relationship
rows.option_3_text: She feels good about the other activities that she has to do

rows.question_text: What positive childhood experiences do you remember in your relationship with your mother/father/caregiver?
rows.option_4_text: Allowed me to play with friends
rows.option_7_text: Had opportunities to positively teach a new skill

rows.question_text: What negative childhood experiences do you remember in your relationship with your mother/father/caregiver?
rows.option_4_text: Not being allowed to play with my friends

rows.question_text: Name one thing about your female/male caregiver that you want to take into your relationship with your children.
rows.option_4_text: Allowed me to play with friends
rows.option_7_text: Had opportunities to positively teach a new skilll

rows.question_text: Name one thing about your female/male caregiver that you do not want to repeat with your children?
rows.option_3_text: Not being allowed to play with friends

rows.question_text: Do you have a similar experience and practices like Mr. Semakula and his family?
Do you find time to cuddle your little kids at least once a week?
Do you purpose to have out and indoor games with your children at least once a week?
Did you learn anything new?
What does Sarah do to get attention from the mother?
rows.option_1_text: She tries to join the brother so that they play together,
rows.option_2_text: She takes away for brother's blocks

rows.question_text: Why is it important for Sarah to get the mother’s attention?
rows.option_1_text: Just like all children she wants to be attended to
rows.option_2_text: She does not appreciate the fact that the mother is busy
rows.option_3_text: She wants to disturb the brother

rows.question_text: What behavior is the mother rewarding by responding to the needs of Sarah’s brother?
Why might it be a problem to say “I will tell your father”?
rows.option_1_text: The child might think that parent has no authority
rows.option_2_text: Child might take parent for granted
rows.option_3_text: Delay to discipline is sometimes not discipline
rows.option_4_text: Child might start to dislike the father

rows.question_text: What would be a better way to respond?
rows.option_1_text: Finding ways to having the 2 children play together
rows.option_2_text: Solving the situation and not refering to the father

rows.question_text: How does the mother communicate to the child about house rules?
rows.option_1_text: She speaks calmly to the child
rows.option_2_text: She sits at the same level with the child
rows.option_3_text: She has a watch to help the child understand well the timelines

rows.question_text: How does the mother talk to the child to make sure that he is really listening?
rows.option_1_text: She speaks calmly to the child
rows.option_2_text: She sits at the same level with the child

rows.question_text: Is the house rule connected to a specific behavior?
What does the mother do to support the child when he follows the house rule?
rows.option_1_text: She has a watch to help the child understand well the timelines
rows.option_2_text: Appreciates the child for returning early

rows.question_text: What practices should men adapt to help them move from inside the gender box to outside the gender box as they try to become a better spouses and parents?
rows.option_4_text: Have open disussions with their family and actively listen to them
rows.option_5_text: Have safe space for as a person to relax and reflect

rows.question_text: What practices should women adapt to help them move from inside the gender box to outside the gender box as they try to become a better spouses and parents?
rows.option_1_text: Support their family financially by providing for household expenses
rows.option_2_text: Spend more time with their spouse
rows.option_3_text: Engage more in formal meetings and engagments
rows.option_4_text: Have safe space for as a person to relax and reflect
rows.option_5_text: Spend more time with children and family

rows.question_text: What can be done to promote a more equitable distribution of labour in the households?
Are there components of the story that relate to your intimate relationship?
What do you like about marriage?
rows.option_2_text: The gifts of children and the privilege to parent them
rows.option_3_text: The respect I earn as a married woman/ a married man

rows.question_text: What don’t you like about marriage?
rows.option_1_text: Blame game which many times affects the woman most for every failure be it with the children, finances, health of the children, bad food etc. The man is ever right.
rows.option_3_text: Incase of any conflict between the couple the children suffer innocently because the man will transfer the anger to the children more over his children and the reverse is true.

rows.question_text:
Why is it good or bad for married couples to relate like those
in the story?
What would you do to make your marital relationship and intimacy enjoyable?
rows.option_1_text: Being patient, kind and supportive in a marriage relationship
rows.option_2_text: Ensuring communication is not cut off between us.
rows.option_3_text: Accepting feedback and work towards improving it.
rows.option_4_text: Not sexually starving each other to promote faithfulness.
rows.option_5_text: Where we are failing to resolve the conflict between us, involving a trusted third party.
rows.option_6_text: Being fair and respectful in a marriage relationship

rows.option_1_text: Strict parents abusive schools, staying at school without meals

rows.option_1_text: By praising and appreciating who they are
rows.option_2_text: Discussing to them always to find out the issues in their lives that may affect their education
rows.option_5_text: Improving parent - child relationship by getting involved in activities they like

rows.question_text: What influences young people to behave in ways that are different from their values (possible answers

rows.option_2_text: Drinking alcohol and use of drugs

rows.question_text: Why do you think your child/ren is the target of this moral conflict?
rows.option_1_text: Because they are easily tamed or influenced
rows.option_2_text: Vulnerable stage for all children and young people
rows.option_3_text: Many children are not attended to and left in the hand of strangers

rows.question_text: What positive things can you do to get there to your child/ren before all the others in the race?
rows.option_1_text: Improving parent – child relationship and communication
rows.option_2_text: Ensuring that am their first educator in their lives
rows.option_3_text: Introducing God in their lives early enough and encouraging them to have a personal relationship with Him
rows.option_4_text: Being intentional in the kind of schools they attend
rows.option_5_text: Being interested in their friends so that we guide on the kind of friends they should have

rows.question_text: Which role have played to ensure that you resolve any conflicts and support your child to overcome these challenges?
As a parent, what opportunities do you provide for your child/ren to inspire their learning to achieve and thrive in education?
rows.option_2_text: Monitoring them in school and checking how best to support them.
rows.option_3_text: Having a good relationship with their teachers/school administrators.
rows.option_5_text: Showing them love and discipline them positively.

rows.question_text: Does your child/ren have a mentor who can regularly support him/her in their drive to thrive in their education?
